intro: Porana racemosa, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Porana racemosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
